subject: Investing
title: The Investment Journal
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Investment Journal.

hook.text: A trader kept a journal for a year and found that 70% of his impulsive trades lost money.

buildup.text: An investment journal records every trade: the thesis, the emotion, and the outcome.

discovery.text: Reviewing entries reveals patterns: you always buy after rallies, panic on Mondays, or chase tips.

twist.text: The journal doesn't change your biases. It makes them visible so you can build rules against them.

climax.text: Elite traders at hedge funds are required to journal. Individual investors can borrow the same edge.

punchline.text: Write down why you're buying. Future you will thank present you.

quiz.question: What should an investment journal record?
options: The thesis, emotion, and outcome of every trade
